so paranoid only allows expert, so youll both need to play on expert

however hotel california allows you to play on m/h/x so you can play on hard mode and the other player can use medium

ok i downloaded it and burned it, and it works fine. but pretty much all of the songs that werent in gh or gh2 are all off beat, such as stairway to heaven. but the origional songs seem to be all right, like bark at the moon. any way i can fix this?
Paranoid seems to freeze every time I play it.

unforunately the paranoid notechart was messed up so it crashes everytime, sorry. all songs i tried so far have no syncing issues but when i play stairway ill be sure to let you know if its just a problem on your end or not.

Yah, Godfather theme seems to lock up aswell towards the end. Paranoid locks up straight away. I tried stairway to heaven, timing was fine most of the time, just some of the time the notes were slightly off. The only thing was, the song volume was so low!!
Hells yeah man, good job!
ok if its just me that has syncing issues, what burning program did u use to burn the .iso with? i used MediaNow, but i can also use alcohol 120%.

I used Dvd Decrypter, and burnt at lowest speed. Sometimes i do notice some keys are slightly out of sync, but 95% of the time, i find the notes are fine. It's not that noticable, just depends on the notecharts used, some are better than others. I think other than locking up of the 2 songs i mentioned above, everything else works great in this hack, I'm enjoying it a lot, just wish i was a better player...i failed thunderstruck on 1%...ahahaha
ok thanks Saaaaaad. i'll burn it as soon as i can and test it.
ill be sure to keep all these bugs in mind to straighten them out in the next version :)

Umm...one thing i found today, is that some notes don't appear properly. I was playing Tell Me Baby, and there was a part where there's meant to be a long note. It wasn't there, and i could just hear the music in the background. I thought the notechart just didn't have that note, but then the note just appeared out of nowhere, and canceled my multiplier, as if it had been there all along.
